alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 05 at 4:41PM AKST until December 06 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulation 4 to 8 inches for East Anchorage, Anchorage Hillside, and along the Glenn Highway to Birchwood and Chugiak. Total snow accumulation of 2 to 4 inches for West Anchorage. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop across the Anchorage Bowl early Thursday morning with the heaviest snow expected around the Thursday morning commute. With colder temperatures in place, the snow is expected to be dry and powdery. Visibility may be significantly reduced along area roadways due to the combination of falling snow and resuspended snow from vehicular traffic. The snow is expected to taper off from west to east by Thursday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
